intro: Phyllanthodendron minutiflorum, commonly known as the dwarf flowered phyllanthodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows as an understory species in humid, shaded environments. It has a compact growth habit with short, woody stems and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
